intro: Struthanthus macrostachyus, commonly known as the large-stemmed desert star, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Loasaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers and succulent, hairy stems. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and open landscapes. Its leaves are small, fleshy, and arranged oppositely along the stems, aiding in water conservation. The showy flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
